definition: to lean against or on/to stand by the side of/to come near to/to depend on/to trust/to fuck (vulgar)/traditional military costume drama where the performers wear armor (old)
to say/to tell/to announce/to report/to denounce/to file a lawsuit/to sue
abbr. for 非洲[Fei1 zhou1], Africa
to not be/not/wrong/incorrect/non-/un-/in-/to reproach or blame/(colloquial) to insist on/simply must
to rely on sth (for support etc)/to depend on
to be affiliated with/to operate under the wing of/affiliation
to rely on help from sb
to keep to the side/to pull over/move aside!
(of a boat) to reach the shore/to pull toward shore/close to shore/landfall

sentences.chinese: 吉姆靠给人擦皮鞋为生。

sentences.english: Within three years he accumulated great wealth by speculations in stocks.
sentences.chinese: 三年内他靠炒买股票积聚了大量财富。

sentences.english: Blind people recognise things by feeling them.
When making self-introduction, how many minutes should it take?
sentences.chinese: 做自我介绍时，应站在靠哪边的位置？

sentences.english: Life is not a dream, destiny is held in our own hands.
sentences.chinese: 浮生并非若梦，命运还靠自己把握。

sentences.english: He got ahead by sucking off.
sentences.chinese: 他是靠吹吹拍拍爬上去的。

sentences.english: The lifts are in the lobby near the main entrance.
sentences.chinese: 电梯间在大厅靠大门外。

sentences.english: Whales and dolphins rely on their responsive hearing to interpret returning echolocation clicks.
sentences.chinese: 鲸鱼和海豚靠回声定位系统来辨别方向。

sentences.english: Some of the farmers had quit farming and were cutting railroad ties so they could feed their families.
sentences.chinese: 有些农民放弃了耕作，靠砍伐铺铁路的枕木养家糊口。

sentences.english: The party was kept together by personal loyalty to the leader.
sentences.chinese: 这个党是靠对领袖的个人忠诚而维系在一起的。

sentences.english: To play Mah-jong well depends on both your skill and luck.
sentences.chinese: 要玩好麻将不仅要靠技术还要靠运气。

sentences.english: To play Mah-jong well depends on both your skill and luck.
sentences.chinese: 要玩好麻将不仅要靠技术还要靠运气。

sentences.english: Cultivating academicians mainly depends on the most famous university, scientific research institution and the great masters.
sentences.chinese: 培养院士主要靠最著名的大学和科研机构，靠大师。

sentences.english: Cultivating academicians mainly depends on the most famous university, scientific research institution and the great masters.
sentences.chinese: 培养院士主要靠最著名的大学和科研机构，靠大师。

sentences.english: However, Li Keran maintained traditional Chinese brushstroke techniques and painting skills.
sentences.chinese: 然而，李可染的画法又靠了传统笔画的表现手法。

sentences.english: In order to get next to a dock, a vessel had to turn its rudder to the outside.
sentences.chinese: 为了靠上码头，船只必须将船舵转向外侧。

definition: to rely on sth (for support etc)/to depend on
to subsist/to eke out a living/to keep body and soul together
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next
variant of 是[shi4]/(used in given names)
to lean against/to rely on/on the basis of/no matter (how, what etc)/proof
(emphasizes that sth is precisely or exactly as stated)/precisely/exactly/even/if/just like/in the same way as
to draw support from/with the help of
of/~'s (possessive particle)/(used after an attribute)/(used to form a nominal expression)/(used at the end of a declarative sentence for emphasis)
to hope for sth/to count on/hope
can only/obliged to do sth/to have no other choice
to use/to employ/to have to/to eat or drink/expense or outlay/usefulness/hence/therefore
